Scenario / Category: List of Resources for cluster Backup/Restore
Test Description:
List of Resources for cluster config backup
 
K8s Objects:
    - Service Account 
    - Config Map 
    - Cron Job 
    - Daemon Set 
    - Deployment 
    - Hpa 
    - Ingress 
    - Limits 
    - Network Policy 
    - Persistent Volume Claim 
    - Quota 
    - Replica Set 
    - Replication Controller 
    - Role 
    - Role Binding
    - Secret 
    - Service 
    - Stateful Set 

Diamanti Storage:
    - Local Volume
    - Remote Volume
    - Mirrored Volume
    - Snapshots
    - LCVs
Diamanti Networking:
    - Static Endpoint
    - Endpoint prefix
    - Host Network
    - Network (blue, green etc)
Diamanti Performance Tier:
    - Perf Tier
    - Perf Tier with Min Max (iops/BW)
Diamanti RBAC:
   - Groups
   - Local Users
   - Remote Users
   - Auth Servers
Diamanti Cluster Specific:
   - Cluster/Node-ids
   - Cluster/Nodes
   - Cluster/ServerCerts

Scenario / Category: List of Resources need to Verify After Node Backup/Restore
Test Description:
1) Network Configuration Files (In case of Bonding, Bond interface files) 
2) NTP & DNS Configuration Files 
3) D10 Node Level Certificates 
4) Zone Configuration File (In case of multizone) 
5) Docker Configuration 
6) System Level Certs 
7) Docker Proxy information 
8) Docker Registry Certificates

Scenario / Category: Initiate and Restore Cluster Backups
Cluster Backup (on-demand) - Initiating and Restore from local storage
Test Description:
Create resources from above list, take backup delete cluster and restore backup  
Verify everything works fine as previous

Scenario / Category: Cluster Backup (on-demand) - Initiating and Restore from nfs storage
Test Description:
Create resources from above list, take backup delete cluster and restore backup 
Verify everything works fine as previous

Test Description:

Scenario / Category: Cluster Backup from restored cluster - Initiating and Restore from local/nfs storage
Test Description:
Create cluster
Create resources from above list
Take backup
Delete Cluster 
Restore backup
Create some more resources
Take backup
Delete clustre and restore backup
Verify everything works as expected

Scenario / Category: Take cluster backup from one cluster restore on another cluster
Test Description:
Create cluster on one set of nodes
Create resources from above list
Take backup

Restore backup on another set of nodes
Verify everything is working as expected
Expected Behaviour: Need to confirm do we support this
